casebody.data:
STATE
v.
Christina Shea WALTERS 548A00-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 1, 2018 Shelagh R. Kenney, Attorney at Law, Malcolm Ray Hunter, Jr., Attorney at Law, Durham, for Walters, Christina Shea. Danielle Marquis Elder, Special Deputy Attorney General, Jonathan P. Babb, Special Counsel to Attorney General, William R. West, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina. James E. Williams, Jr., Attorney at Law, Carrboro, for N.C. Advocates for Justice. James E. Coleman, Jr., Attorney at Law, Dallas, TX, for Becton, Charles, et al. Robert P. Mosteller, Attorney at Law, for Retired Members of NC Judiciary.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 30th of May 2017 by Retired Members of the North Carolina Judiciary for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 1st of March 2018."
